item.title: nastaran add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does. It is up to you to give [life] a meaning." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Jean Paul Sartre
item.description: "Better to die on one's feet than to live on one's knees." -- Jean Paul Sartre

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "When the rich wage war it's the poor who die." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Harold Pinter
item.description: "One way of looking at speech is to say that it is a constant stratagem to cover nakedness." -- Harold Pinter

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Harold Pinter
item.description: "There are no hard distinctions between what is real and what is unreal, nor between what is true and what is false. A thing is not necessarily either true or false; it can be both true and false." -- Harold Pinter

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "But no one came. Because no one ever does." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "From childhood I had never believed in permanence, and yet I had longed for it. Always I was afraid of losing happiness. This month, next year...death was the only absolute value in my world. Lose life and one would lose nothing again forever." -- Graham Greene

item.title: nastaran add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "I am tomorrow, or some future day, what I establish today. I am today what I established yesterday or some previous day." -- James Joyce

item.title: nastaran add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "All Moanday, Tearday, Wailsday, Thumpsday, Frightday, Shatterday." -- James Joyce

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Life is a gamble, at terrible odds. If it were a bet you wouldnâ€™t take it." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: nastaran add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something. You certainly usually find something, if you look, but it is not always quite the something you were after." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: nastaran add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I will not say, do not weep, for not all tears are an evil." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: nastaran add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "A single dream is more powerful than a thousand realities." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: nastaran add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: nastaran add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "In this hour, I do not believe that any darkness will endure." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: nastaran add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The world is full enough of hurts and mischances without wars to multiply them." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: nastaran add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "What's in a name? That is what we ask ourselves in childhood when we write the name that we are told is ours." -- James Joyce

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Bram Stoker
item.description: "We learn from failure, not from success!" -- Bram Stoker

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Bram Stoker
item.description: "Loneliness will sit over our roofs with brooding wings." -- Bram Stoker

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Arthur Miller
item.description: "I cannot sleep for dreaming; I cannot dream but I wake and walk about the house as though I'd find you comin' through the door." -- Arthur Miller

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Arthur Miller
item.description: "Because it is my name! Because I cannot have another in my life! Because I lie and sign myself to lies! Because I am not worth the dust on the feet of them that hang! How may I live without my name? I have given you my soul; leave me my name!" -- Arthur Miller

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "He wanted and needed their love, but felt none towards them. He now had neither love nor humility nor purity" -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Anton Pavlovich Chekhov
item.description: "And what does it mean--dying? Perhaps man has a hundred senses and when he dies, he only loses the five we know, while the other ninety-five go on living." -- Anton Pavlovich Chekhov

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Marlene Dietrich
item.description: "Ich hab' noch einen Koffer in Berlin." -- Marlene Dietrich

item.title: nastaran add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "People ask you for criticism, but they only want praise." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "Sometimes, I feel the past and the future pressing so hard on either side that there's no room for the present at all." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: nastaran add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "Every true artist is the salvation of every other. Only artists produce for each other a world that is fit to live in." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "The cost of oblivious daydreaming was always this moment of return, the realignment with what had been before and now seemed a little worse. " -- Ian McEwan

item.title: nastaran add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "But you can't make people listen. They have to come round in their own time, wondering what happened and why the world blew up around them. It can't last." -- Ray Bradbury
